<h3 id="X22">X(22)&nbsp;=&nbsp;EXETER POINT<a id="ExeterPoint"></a></h3>
Trilinears&nbsp;&nbsp; a(b<sup>4</sup> + c<sup>4</sup> - a<sup>4</sup>) : b(c<sup>4</sup> + a<sup>4</sup> -         b<sup>4</sup>) : c(a<sup>4</sup> + b<sup>4</sup> - c<sup>4</sup>)
<br>
Barycentrics&nbsp;&nbsp;a<sup>2</sup>(b<sup>4</sup> + c<sup>4</sup> - a<sup>4</sup>) : b<sup>2</sup>(c<sup>4</sup> + a<sup>4</sup> - b<sup>4</sup>) : c<sup>2</sup>(a<sup>4</sup> + b<sup>4</sup> - c<sup>4</sup>)
<br>
Barycentrics&nbsp;&nbsp; sin 2A - tan &omega; : sin 2B - tan &omega; : : (M. Iliev, 5/13/07)
<br>
Barycentrics&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; tan B + tan C - tan A + tan &omega; : : (R. Hutson, 10/13/15)
<b><br>
X(22) = 3 R^2 X(2) - SW X(3)
</b>
<p>
As a point on the Euler line, X(22) has Shinagawa coefficients (E + 2F, -2E - 2F).
</p>
<p>
X(22) is the perspector of the circummedial triangle and the tangential triangle; also X(22) = X(55)-of-the-tangential triangle if ABC is acute. See the note just before X(1601) for a generalization.
</p>
<p>
Let La be the polar of X(3) wrt the A-power circle, and define Lb, Lc cyclically.  Let A' = Lb&cap;Lc, B' = Lc&cap;La, C' = La&cap;Lb.  The triangle A'B'C' is homothetic to the anticomplementary triangle, and the center of homothety is X(22).  (Randy Hutson, September 5, 2015)
</p>
<p>
If you have The Geometer's Sketchpad, you can view <a href="X(22).gsp" class="bold">Exeter point</a>.
</p>
<p>
If you have GeoGebra, you can view <a href="X(22).ggb"><b>Exeter point</b></a>.
<p>

{37517, 44109}, {37779, 39899}, {38738, 39854}, {38749, 39825}, {39172, 40358}, {39807, 39820}, {39836, 39849}, {40120, 44064}, {40643, 41262}, {41447, 41468}, {41448, 41469}, {41594, 41730}, {41602, 41736}, {41605, 41740}, {41612, 41743}, {43816, 43829}
</p>
<p>
X(22) is the {X(3),X(25)}-harmonic conjugate of X(2). For a list of other harmonic conjugates of X(22), click <b>Tables</b> at the top of this page.
</p>
<p>
X(22) = reflection of X(378) in X(3)<br>
X(22) = isogonal conjugate of X(66)<br>
X(22) = isotomic conjugate of X(18018)<br>
X(22) = complement of X(7391)<br>
X(22) = anticomplement of X(427)<br>
X(22) = circumcircle-inverse of X(858)<br>
X(22) = polar-circle-inverse of X(37981)<br>
X(22) = X(76)-Ceva conjugate of X(6)<br>
X(22) = cevapoint of X(3) and X(159)<br>
X(22) = crosspoint of X(99) and X(250)<br>
X(22) = crosssum of X(125) and X(512)<br>
X(22) = crossdifference of every pair of points on the line X(647)X(826)<br>
X(22) = X(i)-beth conjugate of X(j)  for these (i,j): (643,345), (833,22)<br>
X(22) = pole, with respect to circumcircle, of the de Longchamps line<br>
X(22) = isotomic conjugate of the isogonal conjugate of X(206)<br>
X(22) = tangential isogonal conjugate of X(6)<br>
X(22) = crosspoint of X(3) and X(159) wrt both the excentral and tangential triangles<br>
X(22) = homothetic center of the tangential triangle and the orthic triangle of the anticomplementary triangle<br>
X(22) = insimilicenter of circumcircle and tangential circle when ABC is acute<br>
X(22) = exsimilicenter of circumcircle and tangential circle when ABC is obtuse<br>
X(22) = inverse-in-de-Longchamps-circle of X(5189)<br>
X(22) = inverse-in-{circumcircle, nine-point circle}-inverter of X(2072)<br>
X(22) = X(75)-isoconjugate of X(2353)<br>
X(22) = trilinear pole of line X(2485)X(8673)<br>
X(22) = homothetic center of anticomplementary and Ara triangles<br>
X(22) = Thomson-isogonal conjugate of X(5654)<br>
X(22) = Lucas-isogonal conjugate of X(11459)<br>
X(22) = X(19)-isoconjugate of X(14376)<br>
</p>
